availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel T. Hayes (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Armacinda Hayes. Father of Polly Hayes, Georgiette Hayes, Armacinda Hayes, and Carry Hayes. Farmer in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned thirty-three enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 229A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 695.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 467.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 406B-407A.
